title: How did the old New York Stock Exchange work? - Quora

response.answer_text: New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) dealers wearing the trademark mesh-backed smocks with numeric IDS met on the trading floor for trading.  They were trading stocks of US' s greatest companies . Face-to-face. Auction style. Paper and pencil technology.  Trades required human intervention took about 10 seconds.  It was floor of flying papers and screaming traders.   Open Outcry Auction Process gave way to automated trading introduced in 1995, through the use of wireless hand held computers. This ended a 200 year old paper transactions. Later SEC permitted traders to trade bonds, Nasdaq-stocks and exchange traded funds. NYSE rolled out an hybrid system combining electronic and human trading. There was 50 percent decrease in floor brokers trade volume of the total volume between first quarter of 2006 and first quarter of 2007. By that time NASDAQ stock exchange and London stock exchanges were fully automated. NYSE was the last.

It was known as Floor Based Trading System (FBTS).presently all major exchanges turned to Screen Based Trading system (SBTS). for more details on this topic u can go through a book TRADING & EXCHANGES by Larry Harris.
